}

1.196. <title>

<title> contiene il titolo completo di una qualsiaisi opera. [3.11.2.2. Titles, Authors, and Editors 2.2.1. The Title Statement 2.2.5. The Series Statement]
Modulocore
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.canonical (@key, @ref) att.datable (@calendar, @period) (att.datable.w3c (@when, @notBefore, @notAfter, @from, @to)) (att.datable.iso (@when-iso, @notBefore-iso, @notAfter-iso, @from-iso, @to-iso)) (att.datable.custom (@when-custom, @notBefore-custom, @notAfter-custom, @from-custom, @to-custom, @datingPoint, @datingMethod)) att.typed (type, @subtype)
typeclassifica il titolo seguendo una tipologia conveniente.
Derivato daatt.typed
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
I valori esemplificativi includono:
main
titolo
sub
(subordinato) sottotitolo, titolo di una parte
alt
(alternativo) titolo alternativo, spesso in altra lingua, con il quale è anche conosciuta l'opera
short
abbreviazione del titolo
desc
(descrittivo) parafrasi descrittiva dell'opera che funge da titolo
levelindica il livello bibliografico di un titolo, ovvero se indentifica un articolo, un libro, una rivista, una collana, o materiale non pubblicato.
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
I valori legali sono:
a
(analitico) titolo analitico (articolo, poesia o altra unità bibliografica pubblicata come parte di un'unità più grande)
m
(monografico) titolo della monografia (libro, raccolta o altra unità bibliografica pubblicata indipendentemente, inculso il singolo volume di opere a più volumi)
j
(rivista) titolo di rivista
s
(serie) titolo di collana
u
(unpublished) titolo di materiale non pubblicato (incluse tesi non pubblicate da case editrici)
Membro del
model.emphLike
Contenuto in
core: abbr analytic author bibl biblScope date distinct editor emph expan foreign gloss head headItem headLabel item label measure meeting mentioned monogr name note num orig p pubPlace publisher q quote ref reg resp rs said series sic soCalled speaker stage street term textLang time title unclear unit
figures: figDesc
header: authority change creation distributor edition extent funder geoDecl handNote language licence principal rendition titleStmt
linking: ab seg
namesdates: bloc country district education forename geogFeat geogName nameLink nationality objectName occupation offset orgName persName placeName region residence roleName settlement sex surname
textstructure: byline closer dateline docImprint imprimatur signed titlePart
transcr: fw metamark mod restore retrace secl supplied surplus
Può contenere
certainty: respons
core: abbr address bibl biblStruct cb choice cit date distinct emph expan foreign gloss graphic index label lb list listBibl measure media mentioned milestone name note num orig pb ptr q quote ref reg rs said sic soCalled stage term time title unclear unit
figures: figure
header: biblFull idno
linking: seg
namesdates: bloc climate country district forename geo geogFeat geogName listObject listOrg location nameLink objectName offset orgName persName placeName population region roleName settlement state surname terrain
textstructure: floatingText
transcr: fw handShift listTranspose metamark mod redo restore retrace secl space subst substJoin supplied surplus undo
caratteri di testo
Nota

The attributes key and ref, inherited from the class att.canonical may be used to indicate the canonical form for the title; the former, by supplying (for example) the identifier of a record in some external library system; the latter by pointing to an XML element somewhere containing the canonical form of the title.

Esempio
<title>Information Technology and the Research Process: Proceedings of a conference held at Cranfield Institute of Technology, UK, 18–21 July 1989</title>
Esempio
<title>Hardy's Tess of the D'Urbervilles: a machine readable edition</title>
Esempio
<title type="full">  <title type="main">Synthèse</title>  <title type="sub">an international journal for    epistemology, methodology and history of    science</title> </title>
Content model
<content>
 <macroRef key="macro.paraContent"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element title
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   tei_att.canonical.attributes,
   tei_att.typed.attribute.subtype,
   tei_att.datable.attributes,
   attribute type { text }?,
   attribute level { "a" | "m" | "j" | "s" | "u" }?,
   tei_macro.paraContent
}

1.197. <titlePage>

<titlePage> (frontespizio) contiene il frontespizio di un testo compreso nel peritesto iniziale o finale [4.6. Title Pages]
Modulotextstructure
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
typeclassifica il frontespizio in base a una tipologia funzionale
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
Membro del
model.frontPart
Contenuto in
textstructure: back front
Può contenere
certainty: respons
core: cb graphic index lb milestone note pb
figures: figure
textstructure: argument byline docImprint epigraph imprimatur titlePart
transcr: fw listTranspose metamark space substJoin
Esempio
<titlePage>  <docTitle>   <titlePart type="main">THOMAS OF Reading.</titlePart>   <titlePart type="alt">OR, The sixe worthy yeomen of the West.</titlePart>  </docTitle>  <docEdition>Now the fourth time corrected and enlarged</docEdition>  <byline>By T.D.</byline>  <figure>   <head>TP</head>   <p>Thou shalt labor till thou returne to duste</p>   <figDesc>Printers Ornament used by TP</figDesc>  </figure>  <docImprint>Printed at <name type="place">London</name> for <name>T.P.</name>   <date>1612.</date>  </docImprint> </titlePage>
Content model
<content>
 <sequence>
  <classRef key="model.global"
   maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"/>
  <classRef key="model.titlepagePart"/>
  <alternate maxOccurs="unbounded"
   minOccurs="0">
   <classRef key="model.titlepagePart"/>
   <classRef key="model.global"/>
  </alternate>
 </sequence>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element titlePage
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   attribute type { text }?,
   (
      tei_model.global*,
      tei_model.titlepagePart,
      ( tei_model.titlepagePart | tei_model.global )*
   )
}

1.198. <titlePart>

<titlePart> contiene una sezione o partizione del titolo di un'opera, come specificato nel frontespizio [4.6. Title Pages]
Modulotextstructure
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
typespecifica il ruolo di tale sezione o partizione all'interno del titolo
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
I valori suggeriti includono:
main
titolo principale dell'opera[Valore di default]
sub
(subordinato) sottotitolo dell'opera
alt
(alternativo) titolo alternativo dell'opera
short
forma abbreviata del titolo
desc
(descrittivo) parafrasi descrittiva dell'opera
Membro del
model.pLike.front model.titlepagePart
Contenuto in
textstructure: back front titlePage
Può contenere
certainty: respons
core: abbr address bibl biblStruct cb choice cit date distinct emph expan foreign gloss graphic index label lb list listBibl measure media mentioned milestone name note num orig pb ptr q quote ref reg rs said sic soCalled stage term time title unclear unit
figures: figure
header: biblFull idno
linking: seg
namesdates: bloc climate country district forename geo geogFeat geogName listObject listOrg location nameLink objectName offset orgName persName placeName population region roleName settlement state surname terrain
textstructure: floatingText
transcr: fw handShift listTranspose metamark mod redo restore retrace secl space subst substJoin supplied surplus undo
caratteri di testo
Esempio
<docTitle>  <titlePart type="main">THE FORTUNES    AND MISFORTUNES Of the FAMOUS    Moll Flanders, &amp;c.  </titlePart>  <titlePart type="desc">Who was BORN in NEWGATE,    And during a Life of continu'd Variety for    Threescore Years, besides her Childhood, was    Twelve Year a <hi>Whore</hi>, five times a <hi>Wife</hi> (wherof    once to her own Brother) Twelve Year a <hi>Thief,</hi>    Eight Year a Transported <hi>Felon</hi> in <hi>Virginia</hi>,    at last grew <hi>Rich</hi>, liv'd <hi>Honest</hi>, and died a  <hi>Penitent</hi>.</titlePart> </docTitle>
Content model
<content>
 <macroRef key="macro.paraContent"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element titlePart
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   attribute type { "main" | "sub" | "alt" | "short" | "desc" }?,
   tei_macro.paraContent
}

1.199. <titleStmt>

<titleStmt> (dichiarazione sul titolo) raggruppa le informazioni sul titolo di un'opera e sulle responsabilità del suo contenuto intellettuale. [2.2.1. The Title Statement 2.2. The File Description]
Moduloheader
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
Contenuto in
header: biblFull fileDesc
Può contenere
core: author editor meeting respStmt title
header: funder principal
Esempio
<titleStmt>  <title>Capgrave's Life of St. John Norbert: a machine-readable transcription</title>  <respStmt>   <resp>compiled by</resp>   <name>P.J. Lucas</name>  </respStmt> </titleStmt>
Content model
<content>
 <sequence>
  <elementRef key="title"
   maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="1"/>
  <classRef key="model.respLike"
   maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"/>
 </sequence>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element titleStmt
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   ( tei_title+, tei_model.respLike* )
}

1.200. <transpose>

<transpose> describes a single textual transposition as an ordered list of at least two pointers specifying the order in which the elements indicated should be re-combined. [11.3.4.5. Transpositions]
Modulotranscr
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
Contenuto in
transcr: listTranspose
Può contenere
core: ptr
Nota

Transposition is usually indicated in a document by a metamark such as a wavy line or numbering.

The order in which <ptr> elements appear within a <transpose> element should correspond with the desired order, as indicated by the metamark.

Esempio
<transpose>  <ptr target="#ib02"/>  <ptr target="#ib01"/> </transpose>
The transposition recorded here indicates that the content of the element with identifier ib02 should appear before the content of the element with identifier ib01.
Content model
<content>
 <sequence>
  <elementRef key="ptr"/>
  <elementRef key="ptr"
   maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="1"/>
 </sequence>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element transpose { tei_att.global.attributes, ( tei_ptr, tei_ptr+ ) }

1.201. <unclear>

<unclear> contiene una parola, una frase o un brano che non può essere trascritto con certezza perché è parzialmente illeggibile o incomprensibile nell'originale. [11.3.3.1. Damage, Illegibility, and Supplied Text 3.4.3. Additions, Deletions, and Omissions]
Modulocore
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.editLike (@evidence, @instant) att.dimensions (@unit, @quantity, @extent, @precision, @scope) (att.ranging (@atLeast, @atMost, @min, @max, @confidence))
reasonindica la ragione per la quale è difficile trascrivere il brano.
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di dati1–∞ occorrenze di teidata.enumerated separato da spazio bianco
I valori suggeriti includono:
illegible
(illegibile)
inaudible
(incomprensibile)
faded
background_noise
eccentric_ductus
<div>  <head>Rx</head>  <p>500 mg <unclear reason="illegible">placebo</unclear>  </p> </div>
agentqualora la difficoltà nella trascrizione emerga da danneggiamento, indica la causa del danno qualora possa essere identificata.
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
I valori esemplificativi includono:
rubbing
il danno è causato da segni di strofinamento sui bordi del foglio
mildew
il danno è causato da macchie di umido sulla superficie del foglio
smoke
il danno è causato dal fumo
Membro del
model.choicePart model.linePart model.pPart.transcriptional
Contenuto in
core: abbr author bibl biblScope choice date distinct editor emph expan foreign gloss head headItem headLabel item label measure mentioned name note num orig p pubPlace publisher q quote ref reg rs said sic soCalled speaker stage street term textLang time title unclear unit
header: change distributor edition extent geoDecl handNote licence
linking: ab seg
namesdates: bloc country district education forename geogFeat geogName nameLink nationality objectName occupation offset orgName persName placeName region residence roleName settlement sex surname
textstructure: byline closer dateline docImprint imprimatur signed titlePart
transcr: fw line metamark mod restore retrace secl supplied surplus zone
Può contenere
certainty: respons
core: abbr address bibl biblStruct cb choice cit date distinct emph expan foreign gloss graphic index label lb list listBibl measure media mentioned milestone name note num orig pb ptr q quote ref reg rs said sic soCalled stage term time title unclear unit
figures: figure
header: biblFull idno
linking: seg
namesdates: bloc climate country district forename geo geogFeat geogName listObject listOrg location nameLink objectName offset orgName persName placeName population region roleName settlement state surname terrain
textstructure: floatingText
transcr: fw handShift listTranspose metamark mod redo restore retrace secl space subst substJoin supplied surplus undo
caratteri di testo
Nota

The same element is used for all cases of uncertainty in the transcription of element content, whether for written or spoken material. For other aspects of certainty, uncertainty, and reliability of tagging and transcription, see chapter 21. Certainty, Precision, and Responsibility.

The <damage>, <gap>, <del>, <unclear> and <supplied> elements may be closely allied in use. See section 11.3.3.2. Use of the gap, del, damage, unclear, and supplied Elements in Combination for discussion of which element is appropriate for which circumstance.

The hand attribute points to a definition of the hand concerned, as further discussed in section 11.3.2.1. Document Hands.

Esempio
<u> ...and then <unclear reason="background-noise">Nathalie</unclear> said ... </u>
Content model
<content>
 <macroRef key="macro.paraContent"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element unclear
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   tei_att.editLike.attributes,
   tei_att.dimensions.attributes,
   attribute reason
   {
      list
      {
         (
            "illegible"
          | "inaudible"
          | "faded"
          | "background_noise"
          | "eccentric_ductus"
         )+
      }
   }?,
   attribute agent { text }?,
   tei_macro.paraContent
}

1.202. <undo>

<undo> indicates one or more marked-up interventions in a document which have subsequently been marked for cancellation. [11.3.4.4. Confirmation, Cancellation, and Reinstatement of Modifications]
Modulotranscr
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.spanning (@spanTo) att.transcriptional (@status, @cause, @seq) (att.editLike (@evidence, @instant)) (att.written (@hand)) att.dimensions (@unit, @quantity, @extent, @precision, @scope) (att.ranging (@atLeast, @atMost, @min, @max, @confidence))
targetpoints to one or more elements representing the interventions which are to be reverted or undone.
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di dati1–∞ occorrenze di teidata.pointer separato da spazio bianco
Membro del
model.linePart model.pPart.transcriptional
Contenuto in
core: abbr author bibl biblScope date distinct editor emph expan foreign gloss head headItem headLabel item label measure mentioned name note num orig p pubPlace publisher q quote ref reg rs said sic soCalled speaker stage street term textLang time title unclear unit
header: change distributor edition extent geoDecl handNote licence
linking: ab seg
namesdates: bloc country district education forename geogFeat geogName nameLink nationality objectName occupation offset orgName persName placeName region residence roleName settlement sex surname
textstructure: byline closer dateline docImprint imprimatur signed titlePart
transcr: fw line metamark mod restore retrace secl supplied surplus zone
Può contenereElemento vuoto
Esempio
<line>This is <del change="#s2" rend="overstrike">   <seg xml:id="undo-a">just some</seg>    sample <seg xml:id="undo-b">text</seg>,    we need</del>  <add change="#s2">not</add> a real example.</line> <undo change="#s3" rend="dotted"  target="#undo-a #undo-b"/>
This encoding represents the following sequence of events:
  • "This is just some sample text, we need a real example" is written
  • At stage s2, "just some sample text, we need" is deleted by overstriking, and "not" is added
  • At stage s3, parts of the deletion are cancelled by underdotting, thus reinstating the words "just some" and "text".
Content model
<content>
 <empty/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element undo
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   tei_att.spanning.attributes,
   tei_att.transcriptional.attributes,
   tei_att.dimensions.attributes,
   attribute target { list { + } }?,
   empty
}

1.203. <unit>

<unit> contains a symbol, a word or a phrase referring to a unit of measurement in any kind of formal or informal system. [3.5.3. Numbers and Measures]
Modulocore
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.typed (@type, @subtype) att.measurement (@unit, @quantity, @commodity)
Membro del
model.measureLike
Contenuto in
core: abbr author bibl biblScope date distinct editor emph expan foreign gloss head headItem headLabel item label measure meeting mentioned name note num orig p pubPlace publisher q quote ref reg resp rs said sic soCalled speaker stage street term textLang time title unclear unit
figures: figDesc
header: authority change creation distributor edition extent funder geoDecl handNote language licence principal rendition
linking: ab seg
namesdates: bloc country district education forename geogFeat geogName location nameLink nationality objectName occupation offset orgName persName placeName region residence roleName settlement sex surname
textstructure: byline closer dateline docImprint imprimatur signed titlePart
transcr: fw metamark mod restore retrace secl supplied surplus
Può contenere
certainty: respons
core: abbr address cb choice cit date distinct emph expan foreign gloss graphic index lb measure media mentioned milestone name note num orig pb ptr q quote ref reg rs said sic soCalled term time title unclear unit
figures: figure
header: idno
linking: seg
namesdates: bloc climate country district forename geo geogFeat geogName location nameLink objectName offset orgName persName placeName population region roleName settlement state surname terrain
textstructure: floatingText
transcr: fw handShift listTranspose metamark mod redo restore retrace secl space subst substJoin supplied surplus undo
caratteri di testo
Esempio
<measure>  <num>2</num>  <unit>kg</unit> </measure>
Esempio
<measure type="value">  <num>3</num>  <unit type="time" unit="min">minute</unit> </measure>
Esempio
<measure type="interval">  <num atLeast="1.2">1.2</num> to <num atMost="5.6">5.6</num>  <unit type="velocity" unit="km/h">km/h</unit> </measure>
Esempio
<p>Light travels at <num value="3E10">3×10^10</num>  <unit type="rate" unit="cm/s">   <unit type="space">cm</unit> per <unit type="time">second</unit>  </unit>.</p>
Content model

 <macroRef key="macro.phraseSeq"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element unit
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   tei_att.typed.attributes,
   tei_att.measurement.attributes,
   tei_macro.phraseSeq
}

1.204. <when>

<when> fornisce un'indicazione temporale in termini relativi, rispetto ad altri elementi determinati sulla stessa scala temporale, o in termini assoluti [16.4.2. Placing Synchronous Events in Time]
Modulolinking
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
absoluteindica un valore temporale assoluto
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.temporal.w3c
unitspecifica l'unità temporale nel quale è espresso l'attributo interval, se questo non è ereditato dal genitore <timeline>
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
I valori suggeriti includono:
d
(giorni)
h
(ore)
min
(minuti)
s
(secondi)
ms
(millesimi di secondo)
intervalindica la componente numerica di un intervallo temporale
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.interval
sinceidentifica il punto di riferimento per la determinazione del valore temporale dell'elemento <when> corrente, ottenuto aggiungendo l'intervallo al punto di riferimento temporale
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.pointer
Contenuto in
—
Può contenereElemento vuoto
Nota

On this element, the global xml:id attribute must be supplied to specify an identifier for this point in time. The value used may be chosen freely provided that it is unique within the document and is a syntactically valid name. There is no requirement for values containing numbers to be in sequence.

Esempio
<when interval="20" since="#w2" xml:id="TW3"/>
Content model
<content>
 <empty/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element when
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   attribute absolute { text }?,
   attribute unit { "d" | "h" | "min" | "s" | "ms" }?,
   attribute interval { text }?,
   attribute since { text }?,
   empty
}

1.205. <zone>

<zone> definisce un'area rettangolare contenuta all'interno di un lemento surface [11.1. Digital Facsimiles 11.2.2. Embedded Transcription]
Modulotranscr
AttributiAttributi att.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.coordinated (@start, @ulx, @uly, @lrx, @lry, @points) att.typed (@type, @subtype) att.written (@hand)
rotateindicates the amount by which this zone has been rotated clockwise, with respect to the normal orientation of the parent <surface> element as implied by the dimensions given in the <msDesc> element or by the coordinates of the <surface> itself. The orientation is expressed in arc degrees.
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.count
Valore di default0
Membro del
model.linePart
Contenuto in
transcr: line surface zone
Può contenere
certainty: respons
core: cb choice graphic index lb media milestone note pb unclear
figures: figure
linking: seg
transcr: fw handShift line listTranspose metamark mod path redo restore retrace space substJoin surface undo zone
caratteri di testo
Nota

The position of every zone for a given surface is always defined by reference to the coordinate system defined for that surface.

A graphic element contained by a zone represents the whole of the zone.

A zone may be of any shape. The attribute points may be used to define a polygonal zone, using the coordinate system defined by its parent surface.

A zone is always a closed polygon. Repeating the initial coordinate at the end of the sequence is optional. To encode an unclosed path, use the <path> element.

Esempio
<surface lrx="0" lry="0" ulx="14.54"  uly="16.14">  <graphic url="stone.jpg"/>  <zone points="4.6,6.3 5.25,5.85 6.2,6.6 8.19222,7.4125 9.89222,6.5875 10.9422,6.1375 11.4422,6.7125 8.21722,8.3125 6.2,7.65"/> </surface>
This example defines a non-rectangular zone: see the illustration in section [[undefined PH-surfzone]].
Esempio
<facsimile>  <surface lrx="400" lry="280" ulx="50"   uly="20">   <zone lrx="500" lry="321" ulx="0" uly="0">    <graphic url="graphic.png "/>   </zone>  </surface> </facsimile>
This example defines a zone which has been defined as larger than its parent surface in order to match the dimensions of the graphic it contains.
Content model
<content>
 <alternate maxOccurs="unbounded"
  minOccurs="0">
  <textNode/>
  <classRef key="model.graphicLike"/>
  <classRef key="model.global"/>
  <elementRef key="surface"/>
  <classRef key="model.linePart"/>
 </alternate>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element zone
{
   tei_att.global.attributes,
   tei_att.coordinated.attributes,
   tei_att.typed.attributes,
   tei_att.written.attributes,
   attribute rotate { text }?,
   (
      text
    | tei_model.graphicLike
    | tei_model.global
    | tei_surface
    | tei_model.linePart
   )*
}

2. Model classes

2.1. model.addrPart

model.addrPart raggruppa elementi che costituiscono un indirizzo postale o altro tipo di indirizzo [3.5.2. Addresses]
Modulotei
Usato da
address
Membrimodel.nameLike[model.nameLike.agent[name orgName persName] model.offsetLike[geogFeat offset] model.persNamePart[forename nameLink roleName surname] model.placeStateLike[model.placeNamePart[bloc country district geogName placeName region settlement] climate location population state terrain] idno objectName rs] postBox postCode street

2.2. model.addressLike

model.addressLike raggruppa elementi utilizzati per rappresentare un indirizzo postale o di posta elettronica [1. The TEI Infrastructure]
Modulotei
Usato da
location model.correspActionPart model.pPart.data
Membriaddress

2.3. model.availabilityPart

model.availabilityPart groups elements such as licences and paragraphs of text which may appear as part of an availability statement [2.2.4. Publication, Distribution, Licensing, etc.]
Modulotei
Usato da
availability
Membrilicence

2.4. model.biblLike

Modulotei
Usato da
cit climate event listBibl location model.inter model.personPart object org place population relatedItem sourceDesc state terrain
Membribibl biblFull biblStruct listBibl

2.5. model.biblPart

model.biblPart raggruppa gli elementi che possono apparire all'interno di elementi di citazioni bibliografiche [3.11. Bibliographic Citations and References]
Modulotei
Usato da
bibl
Membrimodel.imprintPart[biblScope distributor pubPlace publisher] model.respLike[author editor funder meeting principal respStmt] availability bibl edition extent objectIdentifier relatedItem series textLang

2.6. model.certLike

model.certLike groups elements which are used to indicate uncertainty or precision of other elements.
Modulotei
Usato da
respons space substJoin
Membrirespons

2.7. model.choicePart

model.choicePart raggruppa gli elementi (escluso l'elemento choice) che possono essere usati in alternanza con <choice> [3.4. Simple Editorial Changes]
Modulotei
Usato da
choice
Membriabbr expan orig reg seg sic supplied unclear

2.8. model.common

model.common raggruppa elementi comuni a livello di porzioni di testo o interlivello [1.3. The TEI Class System]
Modulotei
Usato da
argument body div epigraph figure

2.9. model.correspActionPart

model.correspActionPart groups elements which define the parts (usually names, dates and places) of one action related to the correspondence.
Modulotei
Usato da
correspAction
Membrimodel.addressLike[address] model.dateLike[date time] model.nameLike[model.nameLike.agent[name orgName persName] model.offsetLike[geogFeat offset] model.persNamePart[forename nameLink roleName surname] model.placeStateLike[model.placeNamePart[bloc country district geogName placeName region settlement] climate location population state terrain] idno objectName rs] note

2.20. model.editorialDeclPart

model.editorialDeclPart raggruppa gli elementi utilizzati all'interno di <editorialDecl> e che appaiono più volte.
Modulotei
Usato da
editorialDecl
Membricorrection hyphenation interpretation normalization punctuation quotation segmentation

Modulotei
Usato da
model.highlighted model.limitedPhrase
Membridistinct emph foreign gloss mentioned soCalled term title

Membrispace

The TEI Class System]
Modulotei
Usato da
model.global
Membriindex listTranspose respons substJoin

Usato da
titlePage
